docs.snippet: Hospitals in Dallas have set up Ebola isolation wards and revamped procedures to deal with new patients, as the sprawling Texas city waits to see if the deadly virus spreads following the first case diagnosed on U.S. soil....

headline.main: Dallas Hospitals Set Up Ebola Wards as City Watches for Spread
headline.print_headline: Dallas Hospitals Set Up Ebola Wards as City Watches for Spread

docs.lead_paragraph: Hospitals in Dallas have set up Ebola isolation wards and revamped procedures to deal with new patients, as the sprawling Texas city waits to see if the deadly virus spreads following the first case diagnosed on U.S. soil.

docs.snippet: An Australian jet fighter has made the country's first airstrike against an Islamic State target in Iraq since the Australian government committed its air force to combat missions, defense officials said on Thursday....

headline.main: Australia Launches First Airstrike in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Australia Launches First Airstrike in Iraq

docs.lead_paragraph: An Australian jet fighter has made the country's first airstrike against an Islamic State target in Iraq since the Australian government committed its air force to combat missions, defense officials said on Thursday.

docs.snippet: The developer of a Noah's Ark-based theme park in Kentucky said on Wednesday he would fight for his religious rights after state officials warned he could lose millions in potential tax credits if he hires only people who believe in the biblical f...

headline.main: Kentucky Warns Noah's Ark Theme Park Over Hiring Practices
headline.print_headline: Kentucky Warns Noah's Ark Theme Park Over Hiring Practices

docs.lead_paragraph: The developer of a Noah's Ark-based theme park in Kentucky said on Wednesday he would fight for his religious rights after state officials warned he could lose millions in potential tax credits if he hires only people who believe in the biblical flood.

docs.snippet: A century-old time capsule, filled mostly with documents by long-gone Wall Street businessmen celebrating New York as a commercial hub, was unsealed Wednesday....

headline.main: Century-Old Time Capsule Unsealed in New York
headline.print_headline: Century-Old Time Capsule Unsealed in New York

docs.lead_paragraph: A century-old time capsule, filled mostly with documents by long-gone Wall Street businessmen celebrating New York as a commercial hub, was unsealed Wednesday.

docs.snippet: Taking my son to see the glacier, while there’s still time....
docs.abstract: Taking my son to see the glacier, while there’s still time.

docs.snippet: Jarrod Lyle takes another step back in his amazing return from twice beating leukemia, and this one might be the biggest one yet....

headline.main: Another Big Step in Return of Jarrod Lyle
headline.print_headline: Another Big Step in Return of Jarrod Lyle

docs.lead_paragraph: Jarrod Lyle takes another step back in his amazing return from twice beating leukemia, and this one might be the biggest one yet.

docs.snippet: Former presidential candidate Mitt Romney said Wednesday night that he's still hitting the campaign trail in order to get candidates like Utah Republican Mia Love elected....

headline.main: Mitt Romney Headlines Utah Rally for Mia Love
headline.print_headline: Mitt Romney Headlines Utah Rally for Mia Love

docs.lead_paragraph: Former presidential candidate Mitt Romney said Wednesday night that he's still hitting the campaign trail in order to get candidates like Utah Republican Mia Love elected.

docs.snippet: The widow and children of a Transportation Security Administration agent who was killed by a gunman at Los Angeles International Airport last fall are suing the city and county for $25 million....

headline.main: Family of Slain TSA Agent Sues LA, Airport, County
headline.print_headline: Family of Slain TSA Agent Sues LA, Airport, County

docs.lead_paragraph: The widow and children of a Transportation Security Administration agent who was killed by a gunman at Los Angeles International Airport last fall are suing the city and county for $25 million.

docs.snippet: A Grand Canyon concessionaire has sued the National Park Service, saying a new South Rim services contract gives an unfair advantage to a competitor and would result in a money-losing operation....

headline.main: Grand Canyon Concessionaire Sues Over New Contract
headline.print_headline: Grand Canyon Concessionaire Sues Over New Contract

docs.lead_paragraph: A Grand Canyon concessionaire has sued the National Park Service, saying a new South Rim services contract gives an unfair advantage to a competitor and would result in a money-losing operation.

docs.snippet: Thomas R. Frieden, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, offered condolences to the family of Thomas Eric Duncan, the patient with the first case of Ebola diagnosed in the U.S....

headline.main: C.D.C. Director on Ebola Patient’s Death

docs.lead_paragraph: Thomas R. Frieden, director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, offered condolences to the family of Thomas Eric Duncan, the patient with the first case of Ebola diagnosed in the U.S.
